Way to go {lad/lass}. Welcome to the third training level. From now on your opponents will be veteran fighters; soldiers and arena regulars and the like. These guys know some dirty tricks, so keep your defense up.

You've got the heart of a champion, {lad/lass}, and the sword arm to match. From now on your opponents will be champion fighters. These are the cream of the crop, the finest warriors I have trained. If you can best three of them in a row, you will join their ranks.
It does my heart good to see such a promising talent. You have passed all tiers of training. You can now tell everyone that you have been trained by the master of the training field.
Thank you master.
I wish you good luck in the tournaments. And, don't forget,  if you want to practice your swordwork anytime, just come and say the word.
Your next opponent will be a {s9}. You need to win {reg8} more fights in a row to advance to the next stage. Are you ready?
Yes I am.
Here you go then. Good luck.
Just a minute. I am not ready yet.
Hey, You will never make it if you don't practice.
Ruszaj się.
Good day, my {lord/lady}. We hope to begin production in about {reg4} days
Good day, my {lord/lady}. We are honored that you have chosen to visit us. What do you require?
Very good, my {lord/lady}. Do you require anything else?
Let's go over the accounts.
Let's check the inventories.
I'd like you to sell goods as they are produced.
I'd like you to keep all goods in the warehouse until I arrive.

We currently produce {s3} worth {reg1} denars each week, while the quantity of {s4} needed to manufacture it costs {reg2}, and labor and upkeep are {reg3}.{s9} This means that we theoretically make a {s12} of {reg0} denars a week, assuming that we have no raw materials in the inventories, and that we sell directly to the market.
Could you explain my options related to production?

Certainly, my {lord/lady}. Most of the time, the most profitable thing for you to do would be to let us buy raw materials and sell the finished goods directly to the market. Because of our longstanding relations with the local merchants, we can usually get a very good price.

However, if you find that you can acquire raw materials cheaper outside {s5}, you may place them in the inventories, and we will use them instead of buying from the market. Likewise, if you feel that you can get a better price for the finished goods elsewhere, then you may ask us to deposit what we produce in our warehouses for you to take.
It will no longer be possible for me to continue operating this enterprise.
A pity, my {lord/lady}. If we sell the land and the equipment, and liquidate the inventories, I estimate that we can get {reg4} denars.
That sounds reasonable. Please proceed with the sale.
Hmm. Let's hold off on that.
As you wish. It was an honor to have been in your employ.
That is all for now.
Good day, my lord.
Good day, my lord.
Hello stranger, you seem to be new to {s9}. I am the guild master of the town.
Good day, {playername}.

{playername}, it was an incredible feat to get {s14} and {s15} make peace, and you made it happen. Your involvement has not only saved our town from disaster, but it has also saved thousands of lives, and put an end to all the grief this bitter war has caused. As the townspeople of {s19}, know that we'll be good on our word, and we are ready to pay the {reg12} denars we promised.
Thank you. Let me have the money.
No need for a payment. I only did what was right.
Oh, yes, of course. We had already got the money for you. Here, please accept these {reg12} denars together with our most sincere thanks. Me and the people of our town will not forget your help.

You are indeed an extraordenary person, {sir/madame}, and it is an honour for me to have known you. You not only did what was impiossible and put an end to this terrible war, but you won't even accept a reward for it. Very well, I will not insist on the matter, but please know that you will have our eternal respect and gratitude.
Very nice work, {playername}, you made short work of those lawless curs. Thank you kindly for all your help, and please accept this bounty of 150 denars.
It was my pleasure, {s65}.
Ah, {playername}. Have you any progress to report?
I've killed some looters.
I've brought you some goods.
Not yet, sir. Farewell.

Aye, my scouts saw the whole thing. That should make anyone else think twice before turning outlaw! The bounty is 40 denars for every band, so that makes {reg1} in total. Here is your money, as promised.

And that's not the only good news! Thanks to you, the looters have ceased to be a threat. We've not had a single attack reported for some time now.   If there are any of them left, they've either run off or gone deep into hiding. That's good for business,   and what's good for business is good for the town!   I think that concludes our arrangement, {playername}. Please accept this silver as a token of my gratitude. Thank you, and farewell.
Anything else you need?
Hah, I knew I could count on you! Just tell me which item to take from your baggage, and I'll send some men to collect it. I still need {reg1} denars' worth of goods.
Nothing at the moment, sir.
Anything else you need?
Excellent, here is the money for your {s6}. Do you have any more goods to give me? I still need {reg1} denars' worth of goods.

Well done, {playername}, that's the last of the goods I need. Here is the money for your {s6}, and a small bonus for helping me out. I'm afraid I won't be paying for any more goods, nor bounties on looters, but you're welcome to keep hunting the bastards if any remain. Thank you for your help, I won't forget it.
Good to see you again {playername}. I have heard that you have delivered the cattle successfully. I will tell the merchants how reliable you are. And here is your pay, {reg8} denars.
I heard that you have lost the cattle herd on your way to {s9}. I had a very difficult time explaining your failure to the owner of that herd, {sir/madam}. Do you have anything to say?
I am sorry. But I was attacked on the way.
I am sorry. The stupid animals wandered off during the night.

Well, it was your responsibility to deliver that herd safely, no matter what. You should know that the owner of the herd demanded to be compensated for his loss, and I had to pay him 1000 denars. So you now owe me that money.

{playername} -- I am in your debt for bringing back my friend's daughter.  Please take these {reg8} denars that I promised you.  My friend wished he could give more but paying that ransom brought him to his knees.

Well -- it sounds like you were able to track down the bandits, and show them what happens to those who would disrupt the flow of commerce. Here is your reward: {reg5} denars. It is well earned, and we are most grateful.

I have heard about your deeds. You have given those bandits the punishment they deserved. You are really as good as they say. Here is your reward: {reg5} denars. I would like to give more but those bandits almost brought me to bankruptcy.
According to my accounts, you owe the merchants guild {reg1} denars. I'd better collect that now.
Alright. I'll pay my debt to you.
Excellent. I'll let my fellow merchants know that you are clear of any debts.
I'm afraid I can't pay that sum now.

In that case, I am afraid, I can't deal with you. Guild rules... Come back when you can pay the {reg1} denars. And know that we'll be charging an interest to your debt. So the sooner you pay it, the better.
What can I do for you?
Now... What else may I do for you?
Yes?
Can you tell me about what you do?
Do you happen to have a job for me?
About that job you offered me...
About the job you gave me...
I have some questions of a political nature.
How is trade around here?
How does the wealth of this region compare with the rest of Calradia?
I wish to buy land in this town for a productive enterprise
You already operate a {s4} here. There probably aren't enough skilled tradesmen to start a second enterprise.
Of course, {sir/my lady}. You are the lord of this town, and no one is going to stop you.
Well... Given your relationship with our liege, {s4}, I think that you will not find many here who are brave enough to sell you any land.
Well... To be honest, I think that we in the guild would like to know you a little better. We can be very particular about outsiders coming in here and buying land.
Very good, {sir/my lady}. We in the guild know and trust you, and I think I could find someone to sell you the land you need.

A couple of things to keep in mind -- skilled laborers are always at a premium, so I doubt that you will be able to open up more than one enterprise here. In order to make a profit for yourself, you should choose a commodity which is in relatively short supply, but for which the raw materials are cheap. What sort of enterprise would you like to start?
A mill and bakery, to make bread from grain
A brewery, to make ale from grain
A tannery, to make leather from hides
A wine press, to make wine from grapes
An oil press, to make oil from olives
An ironworks, to make tools from iron
A weavery and dyeworks, to make velvet from silk and dye
A weavery, to make wool cloth from wool
A weavery, to make linen from flax
Never mind

Very good, sir. The land and the materials on which you may build your {s3} will cost you {reg7} denars. Right now, your {s3} will produce {s4} worth {reg1} denars each week, while the {s6} needed to manufacture that batch will be {reg2} and labor and upkeep will be {reg3}.{s9} I should guess that your profit would be {reg0} denars a week. This assumes of course that prices remain constant -- which, I can virtually guarantee you, they will not. Do you wish to proceed?
Yes. Here is money for the land.
No -- that's not economical for me at the moment.
Very good. Your enterprise should be up and running in about a week. When next you come, and thereafter, you should speak to your {s4} about its operations.
[Leave]
I am the guildmaster of {s9}. You can say I am the leader of the good people of {s9}. I can help you find a job if you are looking for some honest work.
Who rules this town?

Our town's lord and protector is {s10}. He owns the castle and sometimes resides there, and collects taxes from the town. However we regulate ourselves in most of the matters that concern ourselves. As the town's guildmaster I have the authority to decide those things.
That's all I need to know. Thanks.

Politics? Good heaven, the guild has nothing to do with politics. We are loyal servants of {s10}. We merely govern our own affairs, and pass on the townspeople's concerns to our lords and masters, and maybe warn them from time to time against evil advice. Anyway, what did you wish to ask?
Did I mention that we here are all {s9}? Because I can't stress that enough... Anyway... Is there anything else?
What is the cause of all these wars in Calradia?

Well, to answer your question generally, each monarch claims to be the rightful heir to the old Calradic emperors. Some of these claims are based on forgotten dynastic marriages and others are based on obscure promises, while {s22} Rhodoks invoke the empire's unwritten constitution. So in theory, any one realm has the right to declare war on any other realm at any time.

In practice, to make war is exhausting work. It is easy enough to lay waste to the enemy's farmland, but crops will grow back, and it is a far different matter to capture an enemy stronghold and to hold it. So the monarchs of Calradia will fight a little, sign a truce, fight a little more, and so on and so forth. Often, a monarch will go to war when another realm provokes them. At such times, some bad influences who look to enrich themselves with ransoms and pillage will clamor for retribution, and thus the damage caused by war to a monarch's treasury is less than the damage caused by doing nothing would be to his authority... I'm of course not talking about {s10}, as no one would ever question {reg4?her:his} authority

I would stress again that we in the guild have nothing to do with politics. But if {s10} were to ask for my advice on these matters, as a loyal subject, I would tell {reg4?her:him} that while {reg4?her:his} claim to all of Calradia is truly just, even the most legitimate claim must be backed by armed men, and armed men want money, and money comes from trade, and war ruins trade, so sometimes the best way to push a claim is not to push it, if you know what I mean...

You may tell {s10} this if you see {reg4?her:him}. Don't mention my name specifically -- just say 'the people of {s4}' told you this. Our personal opinion, of course, as to what would be in {s10}'s best interests. None of us would ever dream of questioning a monarch's sovereign right to push {reg4?her:his} legitimate claims.
What is {s10}'s policy in regards to the other realms of Calradia?
Which realm did you have in mind?
What can you say about the internal politics of the realms?

Well, here in the {s4} we are all united by our love for {s5} and support for {reg4?her:his} legitimate claim to the rulership of all Calradia. But I have heard some talk of internal bickering in other realms...

The lords of a realm often have very different ideas about honor, strategy, and the way a nobleman should behave. In addition, they compete with each other for the ruler's favor, and are constantly weighing up their position -- how they stand, how their friends and family stand, and how their enemies stand.

Underlying all the tensions is the possibility that a lord may abandon his liege, and pledge vassalhood to another. In theory, each lord has sworn an oath of vassalage, but in practice, a vassal can always find an excuse to absolve himself. The vassal may claim that the liege has failed to hold up his end of the bargain, to protect the vassal and treat him justly. Or, the vassal may claim that his liege is in fact a usurper, and another has a better claim to the kingship.

Lieges and vassals still watch each other carefully. If a king believes that his vassal is going to change sides or rebel, he may indict the vassal for treason and seize his properties. Likewise, if a vassal fears that he will be indicted, he may rebel. Usually, whoever makes the first move will be able to control the vassal's fortresses.

Now, men do not trust a vassal who turns coat easily, nor do they trust a king who lightly throws around charges of treason. Those two factors can keep a realm together. But if relations between a vassal and a liege deteriorate far enough, things can become very tense indeed... In other lands, of course. These things could never happen here in the {s4}.
That is all. Thank you.
What about it?
What if I can't finish it?
Well, I'm still working on it.
Good. I'm sure you will handle it.
Eh, you want to reconsider that. Good...
I hope you don't fail. In that case, I'll have to ask for the price of the cargo you were carrying.
Well, just do your best to finish it.
Excellent. I am counting on you then. Good luck.
Well, the job will be available for a few more days I guess. Tell me if you decide to take it.
Well, you look able enough. I think I might have something you could do.

We've had some fighting near the {s5} lately, with all the chaos that comes with it, and that's led some of our less upstanding locals to try and make their fortune out of looting the shops and farms during the confusion. A lot of valuable goods were taken. I need somebody to teach those bastards a lesson. Sound like your kind of work?
Aye, I'll do it.
I'm afraid I can't take the job at the moment.

Excellent! You'll find the looters roaming around the countryside, probably trying to rob more good people. Kill or capture the bastards, I don't care what you do with them. I'll pay you a bounty of 40 denars on every band of looters you destroy, until all the looters are dealt with.

Well, there is a very great favor which you could do us... As you may have heard, some {s10}s have come across the border to attack our people. {s5} is under great pressure from some of the more bellicose of his vassals to respond with a declaration of war. Unfortunately, while the great lords of this land grow rich from bloodshed, we of the commons will be caught in the middle, and will suffer.

We are not saying that {s5} should overlook this aggression -- far from it! But if he charges one of his own lords to respond, then the cycle of provocation will necessarily lead to a full-fledged confrontation. Now, if an outsider were to step in and defeat a {s10} lord in battle, then honor would be done, and it would defuse the clamor for war. If the defeated lord were a known troublemaker -- {s7} -- then the {s10}s might be able to overlook it.

We need you to attack and defeat {s7}. This will not be an easy task, and that outsider would damage {his/her} relationship with the {s10}s, but we would be very grateful. We could not acknowledge a connection with that outsider, but we could be sure that {he/she} would be handsomely rewarded... Could you do this?
Aye, I can do it.
I would prefer not to get mixed up in such things

The raiders are likely to have laid up their ships in a well-concealed cove, somewhere along the coastline, preferably next to a small stream where they have some water. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of sea raiders who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.

Bandits such as these usually establish their hideouts in the foothills on the edge of the desert, often in a canyon near a spring. This gives them both water and concealment. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of desert bandits who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.

Bandits such as these will usually establish a base in the highlands, often on an steep ledge where they have a view of the surrounding countryside. This makes them difficult to surprise. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of mountain bandits who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.

Bandits such as these will usually set up their encampments deep in the woods, sometimes in the middle of a swamp. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of forest bandits who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.

Bandits such as these will usually set up their encampments in the woodland on the steppe, where they have some concealment. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of steppe bandits who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.

Bandits such as these will usually set up their encampments deep in the woods. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of tundra bandits who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.
Aye, I'll do it.
I'm afraid I can't take the job at the moment.
Very good. We will await word of your success.
We have heard that {s4}, some travellers on the road {reg4?to:from} {s5} were attacked by {s7}.

We would like you to track these {s4} down. The merchants of the town were able to get a description of their leader, and have put together a bounty. If you can hunt them down and destroy them, we'll make it worth your while...
Aye, I'll do it.
Very good. The band may not have lingered long in the area, but chances are that they will be spotted by other travellers on the road.
I'm afraid I can't take the job at the moment.
You're looking for a job? Actually I was looking for someone to deliver some {s4}. Perhaps you can do that...
I have a cargo of {s6} that needs to be delivered to the tavern in {s4}. If you can take {reg5} units of {s6} to {s4} in 7 days, you may earn {reg8} denars. What do you say?
Alright. I will make the delivery.
I am afraid I can't carry all that cargo now.
You're looking for a job? Actually I was looking for someone to escort a caravan. Perhaps you can do that...

I am going to send a caravan of goods to {s8}. However with all those bandits and deserters on the roads, I don't want to send them out without an escort. If you can lead that caravan to {s8} in 15 days, you will earn {reg8} denars. Of course your party needs to be at least {reg4} strong to offer them any protection.
Alright. I will escort the caravan.
I am afraid I don't have that many soldiers with me.
Sorry. I can't do that right now
We can cover the rest of the way ourselves. Thanks.
Well, we have almost reached {s21}. We can cover the rest of the way ourselves. Here's your pay... {reg14} denars. Thanks for escorting us. Good luck.
Greetings. You must be our escort, right?
Yes. My name is {playername}. I will lead you to {s1}.
Well, It is good to know we won't travel alone. What do you want us to do now?
Eh. We've made it this far... What do you want us to do?
You follow my lead. I'll take you through a safe route.
Alright. We'll be right behind you.
You stay here for a while. I'll go ahead and check the road.
Alright. We'll be waiting here for you.

Actually, I was looking for an able adventurer like you. There's this group of particularly troublesome bandits. They have infested the vicinity of our town and are preying on my caravans. They have avoided all the soldiers and the militias up to now. If someone doesn't stop them soon, I am going to be ruined...
I will pay you {reg8} denars if you hunt down those troublesome bandits. It's dangerous work. But I believe that you are the {man/one} for it. What do you say?
Very well. I will hunt down those bandits.
You will? Splendid. Good luck to you.
Sorry. I don't have time for this right now.

Actually, I was looking for a reliable {man/helper} that can undertake an important mission. A group of bandits have kidnapped the daughter of a friend of mine and are holding her for ransom. My friend is ready to pay them, but we still need someone to take the money to those rascals and bring the girl back to safety.

The amount the bandits ask as ransom is {reg12} denars. I will give you that money once you accept to take the quest. You have 15 days to take the money to the bandits who will be waiting near the village of {s4}. Those bastards said that they are going to kill the poor girl if they don't get the money by that time. You will get your pay of {reg8} denars when you bring the girl safely back here.
All right. I will take the ransom money to the bandits and bring back the girl.

Good. I knew we could trust you at this. Here is the ransom money, {reg12} denars. Count it before taking it. And please, don't attempt to do anything rash. Keep in mind that the girl's well being is more important than anything else...
Sorry. I don't have time for this right now.
Jestem {s69} {playername}.
Dziękuję. Liczę, że kiedyś będę mógł się odwdzięczyć.
Czego? Nie widzisz, że jesteśmy zajęci? Czy może guza szukasz?
Chcę wykupić jeńca.
Chcę odbić jeńca.
Jestem tu po to aby wykupić jeńca, oddajcie go a nic wam nie będzie.
Sprawiedliwości. Właśnie jestem, aby ją wymierzyć.
Dobra, płacisz {reg20} dukatów i wynocha.
Oto pieniądze.
Nie, to wy mi zapłacicie.
Pięknie, wasz jest. Do zobaczenia znowu.
Niezmiernie mnie to cieszy.
What's it? You have given us the money. We have no more business.
Sorry to bother you. I'll be on my way now.
We have one more business. You'll give the money back to me.
Oh, that business! Of course. Let us get down to it.
Czego? Nie widzisz, że jesteśmy zajęci? Czy może guza szukasz?
Chcę wykupić jeńca.
Chcę odbić jeńca.
Jestem tu po to aby wykupić jeńca, oddajcie go a nic wam nie będzie.
Sprawiedliwości. Właśnie jestem, aby ją wymierzyć.
Dobra, płacisz {reg20} dukatów i wynocha.
Oto pieniądze.
Nie to wy mi zapłacicie.
Pięknie, wasz jest. Do zobaczenia znowu.
No way! You release the girl first.
You fool! Stop playing games and give us the money!
All right. Here's your money. Let the girl go now.
I had left the money in a safe place. Let me go fetch it.
Are you testing our patience or something?  Go and bring that money here quickly.
I have no intention to pay you anything. I demand that you release the girl now!
Niezmiernie mnie to cieszy.
What's it? You have given us the money. We have no more business.
Sorry to bother you. I'll be on my way now.
We have one more business. You'll give the money back to me.
Oh, that business! Of course. Let us get down to it.
Oh {sir/madam}. Thank you so much for rescuing me. Will you take me to my family now?
Yes. Come with me. I'll take you home.
Unfortunately. You do not have room in your party for me.
Oh, thank you so much!
Wait here a while longer. I'll come back for you.
Oh, please {sir/madam}, do not leave me here all alone!
Unfortunately I lost the girl on the way here...
Oh no! How am I going to tell this to my friend?
I'm sorry. I could do nothing about it.
You let me down {playername}. I had trusted you. I will let people know of your incompetence at this task. Also, I want back that {reg8} denars I gave you as the ransom fee.
Of course. Here you are...
At least you have the decency to return the money.
Sorry. I don't have that amount with me.
Do you expect me to believe that? You are going to pay that ransom fee back! Go and bring the money now!

This war between {s15} and {s14} has brought our town to the verge of ruin. Our caravans get raided before they can reach their destination. Our merchants are afraid to leave the safety of the town walls. And as if those aren't enough, the taxes to maintain the war take away the last bits of our savings. If peace does not come soon, we can not hold on for much longer.
You are right. But who can stop this madness called war?
It is your duty to help the nobles in their war effort. You shouldn't complain about it.
Hah. The nobles fight their wars for their greed and their dreams of glory. And it is poor honest folk like us who have to bear the real burden. But you obviously don't want to hear about that.

There have been attempts to reconcile the two sides and reach a settlement. However, there are powerful lords on both sides whose interests lie in continuing the war. These men urge all others not to heed to the word of sensible men, but to keep fighting. While these leaders remain influential, no peace settlement can be reached.
Who are these warmongers who block the way of peace?
Who are these lords you speak of?
They are {s12} from {s15} and {s13} from {s14}. Until they change their mind or lose their influence, there will be no chance of having peace between the two sides.
What can be done about this?
Alas, it seems nothing can be done about it.

There is a way to resolve the issue. A particularly determined person can perhaps persuade one or both of these lords to accept making peace. And even if that fails, it can be possible to see that these lords are defeated by force and taken prisoner. If they are captive, they will lose their influence and they can no longer oppose a settlement... What do you think? Can you do it?
It seems difficult. But I will try.
If the price is right, I may.
Forget it. This is not my problem.

Most of the merchants in the town will gladly open up their purses to support such a plan. I think we can collect {reg12} denars between ourselves. We will be happy to reward you with that sum, if you can work this out. Convince {s12} and {s13} to accept a peace settlement, and if either of them proves too stubborn, make sure he falls captive and can not be ransomed until a peace deal is settled.
All right. I will do my best.
Sorry. I can not do this.
Excellent. You will have our blessings. I hope you can deal with those two old goats. We will be waiting and hoping for the good news.
Don't say no right away. Think about this for some time. If there is a {man/lady} who can manage to do this, it is you.

Do I indeed! There's a group of bandits infesting the town, and I'm at the end of my rope as to how to deal with them. They've been ambushing and robbing townspeople under the cover of night, and then fading away quick as lightning when the guards finally show up. We've not been able to catch a one of them. They only attack lone people, never daring to show themselves when there's a group about. I need someone who can take on these bandits alone and win. That seems to be the only way of bringing them to justice. Are you up to the task?

There's a group of bandits infesting the town, and I'm at the end of my rope as to how to deal with them. They've been ambushing and robbing townspeople under the cover of night, and then fading away quick as lightning when the guards finally show up. We've not been able to catch a one of them. They only attack lone people, never daring to show themselves when there's a group about. I need someone who can take on these bandits alone and win. That seems to be the only way of bringing them to justice. Are you up to the task?
Killing bandits? Why, certainly!
My apologies, I'm not interested.
That takes a weight off my shoulders, {playername}. You can expect a fine reward if you come back successful. Just don't get yourself killed, eh?
One of the merchants here is looking for herdsmen to take his cattle to the market at {s13}.

The cattle herd must be at {s13} within 30 days. Sooner is better, much better, but it must be absolutely no later than 30 days. If you can do that, I'd be willing to pay you {reg8} denars for your trouble. Interested?
Aye, I can take the herd to {s13}.
I am sorry, but no.
Splendid. You can find the herd right outside the town. After you take the animals to {s13}, return back to me and I will give you your pay.
I am afraid I can't offer you a job right now.
My good {sir/madam}. Our village is grateful for your help. Thanks to the {reg5} heads of cattle you have brought, we can now raise our own herd.
My good {lord/lady}, please, is there anything I can do for you?
Good day, {sir/madam}, and welcome to {s9}. I am the elder of this village.
Welcome to {s9}, my {lord/lady}. We were rejoiced by the news that you are the new {lord/lady} of our humble village. I am the village elder and I will be honoured to serve you in any way I can.
{My lord/My lady}, you honour our humble village with your presence.
Good day, {sir/madam}.
Is there anything else I can do for you?
I am looking for a man by the name of {s4}. I was told he may be hiding here.
Strangers come and go to our village, {sir/madam}. But I doubt you'll run into him at this hour of the night. You would have better luck during the day.
Strangers come and go to our village, {sir/madam}. If he is hiding here, you will surely find him if you look around.
About the task you asked of me...
Do you have any tasks I can help you with?
I want to buy some supplies. I will pay with gold.
Of course, {sir/madam}. Do you want to buy goods or cattle?
I want to buy food and supplies.
We have some food and other supplies in our storehouse. Come have a look.
I want to buy some cattle.
I changed my mind. I don't need to buy anything.
Have you seen any enemies around here recently?
I am sorry, {sir/madam}. We have neither seen nor heard of any war parties in this area.
Hmm. Let me think about it...
No, {sir/madam}. We haven't seen any war parties in this area for some time.
Well, I guess that was all.
I need you to set a large fire on the outskirts of this village.
We have already agreed upon this, {sir/my lady}. I will do my best. You can trust me.
A fire, {sir/madam}! Fires are dangerous! Why would you want such a thing?
I believe that we have already discussed this issue, {sir/my lady}.
We talked about this {sir/madam} before and your previous offers were low compared to risk you want me to take.
I have my reasons, and you will have yours -- a purse of silver. Will you do it, or not?
Given the risk you are taking, you are entitled to know my plan.
I wish to rescue a prisoner from {s4}. When you light the fire, the guards in {s4} will see the smoke, and some of them will rush outside to see what is going on.
As you wish, {sir/my lady}. You have been a good friend to this village, and, even though there is a risk, we should be glad to return the favor. When do you want this fire to start?
I'm sorry, {sir/my lady}. You will forgive me for saying this, but we don't exactly have good reason to trust you. This is too dangerous.
As you say, {sir/my lady}. But in doing this, we are taking a very great risk. What's in it for us?
I can give you 100 denars.
I can give you 200 denars.
I can give you 300 denars.
Never mind.
This is madness. I cannot take such a risk.
Then let's increase your reward to 200 denars.
Then let's increase your reward to 300 denars.
Then let's increase your reward to 300 denars. This is my last offer.
Never mind.
Very well. You are asking me to take a very great risk, but I will do it. When do you want this fire to start?
I cannot do such a dangerous thing for 200 denars.
Continue with your preparations. One hour from now, I need that fire.
Do this in at the stroke of midnight. I will wait exactly one hour.
Very well, {sir/my lady}. We will make our preparations. Now you make yours.
As you wish, {sir/my lady}. May the heavens protect you.
Are there any lads from this village who might want to seek their fortune in the wars?
[Leave]
We have {reg5} heads of cattle, each for {reg6} denars. How many do you want to buy?
I am afraid we have no cattle left in the village {sir/madam}.
One.
Two.
Three.
Four.
Five.
Forget it.
I will tell the herders to round up the animals and bring them to you, {sir/madam}. I am sure you will be satisfied with your purchase.
I don't think anyone would be interested, {sir/madam}. Is there anything else I can do for you?
I can think of {reg5} whom I suspect would jump at the chance. If you could pay 10 denars {reg7?each for their equipment:for his equipment}. Does that suit you?
Tell {reg7?them:him} to make ready.
No, not now.
Yes {sir/madam}, have you made any progress on it?
Indeed. I brought you {reg5} packs of grain.
My good {lord/lady}. You have saved us from hunger and desperation. We cannot thank you enough, but you'll always be in our prayers. The village of {s13} will not forget what you have done for us.
My good {lord/lady}, please, is there anything I can do for you?
I am still working on it.
I am afraid I won't be able to finish it.
Thank you, {sir/madam}. We are praying for your success everyday.
Ah, I am sorry to hear that {sir/madam}. I'll try to think of something else.
Well {sir/madam}, you are already engaged with a task helping us. We cannot ask more from you.
No {sir/madam}, We don't have any other tasks for you.
A task?

{My good sir/My good lady}, our village has been going through such hardships lately. The harvest has been bad, and recently some merciless bandits took away our seed grain that we had reserved for the planting season. If we cannot find some grain soon, we will not be able to plant our fields and then we will have nothing to eat for the coming year. If you can help us, we would be indebted to you forever.
Hmmm. How much grain do you need?
I can't be bothered with this. Ask help from someone else.
I think {reg5} packs of grain will let us start the planting. Hopefully, we can find charitable people to help us with the rest.
Then I will go and find you the grain you need.
I am afraid I don't have time for this. You'll need to find help elsewhere.
Thank you, {sir/madam}. We'll be praying for you night and day.
Yes {sir/madam}, of course. I am sorry if I have bothered you with our troubles.

We are suffering greatly at the hands of a group of bandits. They take our food and livestock, and kill anyone who doesn't obey them immediately. Our men are angry that we cannot defend ourselves, but we are only simple farmers... However, with some help, I think that some of the people here could be more than that. We just need an experienced warrior to teach us how to fight.
I can teach you how to defend yourself.
You peasants have no business taking up arms. Just pay the bandits and be off with it.

You will? Oh, splendid! We would be deeply indebted to you, {sir/madam}. I'll instruct the village folk to assemble here and receive your training. If you can teach us how to defend ourselves, I promise you'll receive everything we can give you in return for your efforts.
Yes, of course {sir/madam}. Thank you for your counsel.
Bandits have driven away our cattle. Our pastures are empty. If we had just a few heads of cattle we could start to raise a herd again.
How many animals do you need?
I don't have time for this. Ask help from someone else.
I think {reg5} heads will suffice for a small herd.
Then I will bring you the cattle you need.
I am afraid I don't have time for this. You'll need to find help elsewhere.
Thank you, {sir/madam}. We'll be praying for you night and day.
Yes {sir/madam}, of course. I am sorry if I have bothered you with our troubles.
Thank you, {sir/madam}, but we do not really need anything right now.
{My lord/my lady}, you honour my humble shop with your presence.
Welcome {sir/madam}. What can I do for you?
Anything else?
I want to buy a few items... and perhaps sell some.
Sure, sure... Here, have a look at my stock...
Anything else?
What goods should I buy here to trade with other towns?
Nothing. Thanks.

That information can be best obtained from caravan masters and travelling merchants. If you want I can send you to the district where foreign merchants stay at when they come to the town. If you spend some time there and listen to the talk, you can learn a lot about what to buy and where to sell it.
Then I'll go and spend some time with these merchants.
I have no time for this right now.
Good day friend. If you came to watch the tournaments you came in vain. There won't be a tournament here anytime soon.
Tournaments? So they hold the tournaments here...

Yes. You should see this place during one of the tournament fights. Everyone from the town and nearby villages comes here. The crowd becomes mad with excitement. Anyway, as I said, there won't be an event here soon, so there isn't much to see. Except, there is an official duel every now and then, and  of course we have melee fights almost every day.
Tell me about the melee fights.

The fighters and knights get bored waiting for the next tournament, so they have invented the training melee. It is a simple idea really. Fighters jump into the arena with a weapon. There are no rules, no teams. Everyone beats at each other until there is only one fighter left standing. Sounds like fun, eh?
Is there a reward?

There is, actually. Some of the wealthy townsmen offer prizes for those fighters who show great skill in the fights. If you can beat {reg1} opponents before going down, you'll earn {reg11} denars. You'll get {reg12} denars for striking down at least {reg2} opponents, {reg13} denars if you can defeat {reg3} opponents, and {reg14} denars if you can survive long enough to beat {reg4} opponents. If you can manage to be the last {man/fighter} standing, you'll earn the great prize of the fights, {reg15} denars. Sounds good, eh?

Some of the wealthy townsmen offer prizes for those fighters who show great skill in the fights. If you can beat {reg1} opponents before going down, you'll earn {reg11} denars. You'll get {reg12} denars for striking down at least {reg2} opponents, {reg13} denars if you can defeat {reg3} opponents, and {reg14} denars if you can survive long enough to beat {reg4} opponents. If you can manage to be the last {man/fighter} standing, you'll earn the great prize of the fights, {reg15} denars. Sounds good, eh?
Can I join too?
Ha ha. You would have to be out of your mind not to. Of course. The melee fights are open to all. Actually there is going to be a fight soon. You can go and hop in if you want to.
Hello. You seem to be new here. Care to share your name?
I am {playername}.
Well met {playername}. I am the master of the tournaments here at {s1}. Talk to me if you want to join the fights.

Ha-ha, that's quite the bruise you're sporting. But don't worry; everybody gets trounced once in awhile. The important thing is to pick yourself up, dust yourself off and keep fighting. That's what champions do.
Hey, you managed to take down {reg8} opponents. Not bad. But that won't bring you any prize money. Now, if I were you, I would go back there and show everyone what I can do...
You put up quite a good fight there. Good moves. You definitely show promise. And you earned a prize of {reg10} denars for knocking down {reg8} opponents.
That was a good fight you put up there. You managed to take down no less than {reg8} opponents. And of course, you earned a prize money of {reg10} denars.

Your performance was amazing! You are without doubt a very skilled fighter. Not everyone can knock down {reg8} people in the fights. Of course you deserve a prize with that performance: {reg10} denars. Nice, eh?
That was damned good fighting, {playername}. You have very good moves, excellent tactics. And you earned a prize of {reg10} denars for knocking down {reg8} opponents.

Congratulations champion! Your fight there was something to remember! You managed to be the last fighter standing beating down everyone else. And of course you won the grand prize of the fights: {reg10} denars.
Hello {playername}. Good to see you again.
What would you like to do?
About the melee fights...
Will there be a tournament in nearby towns soon?
I need to leave now. Good bye.
{reg2?There won't be any tournaments any time soon.:{reg1?Tournaments are:A tournament is} going to be held at {s15}.}
There will be a fight here soon. You can go and jump in if you like.
Good. That's what I am going to do.
Thanks. But I will give my bruises some time to heal.
Good {man/girl}. That's clever of you.
Actually, can you tell me about the rewards again?
Nie mam teraz więcej rozkazów. Przewiduję, że jeszcze {reg1} dni potrwa ofensywa naszych wojsk, wesprzyj je w walce z Konfederatami. O nowych rozkazach powiadomię cię przez posłańca.
Hello {boy/girl}. If you have any prisoners, I will be happy to buy them from you.
Then you'd better bring your purse. I have got prisoners to sell.
Not this time. Good-bye.
Let me see what you have...
You take more prisoners, bring them to me. I will pay well.
I'll give you nothing but cold steel, you scum!
There's no need to fight. I can pay for free passage.
Silver without blood, that's our favourite kind! Hmm, having a look at you, I reckon you could easily come up with {reg5} denars. Pay it, and we'll let you be on your way.
Very well, take it.
I don't have that much money with me
That's too bad. I guess we'll just have to sell you into slavery. Take {him/her}, lads!
Hey, I've heard of you! You slaughter us freebooters like dogs, and now you expect us to let you go for a few stinking coins? Forget it. You gave us no quarter, and you'll get none from us.
Heh, that wasn't so hard, was it? All right, we'll let you go now. Be off.
Eh? What is it?
Your luck has run out, wretch. Prepare to die!
Never mind, I have no business with you.
Do you want us to follow you?
Yes. Let us ride together.
No. Not at this time.
Unfortunately. You do not have room in your party for us.
We are at your command.
You will not capture me again. Not this time.
You don't have a chance against me. Give up.
I will give up when you are dead!
I beg you, please leave us alone.
Do you think you can run away from me? You will be my prisoner or die!
Ok. We'll leave you in peace for this time, do not face with us again.
Haven't you got any mercy? Ok, we will fight you to the last man!
Hmmm. 10 denars for each looter makes {reg1} denars for all {reg0} of them.
Let me see. You've brought {reg0} bandits, so 20 denars for each comes up to {reg1} denars.
Well well, you've captured {reg0} brigands. Each one is worth 30 denars, so I'll give you {reg1} for them in total.
I suppose that'll be all, then.
Do not try running away or trying something stupid. I will be watching you.
No, I swear I won't.
Greetings, {your lordship/my lady}. How can I serve you today?
Good day. What can I do for you?
I want to buy a new weapon. Show me your wares.
I am looking for some equipment. Show me what you have.
I am thinking of buying a horse.
Ah, yes {sir/madam}. These arms are the best you'll find anywhere.
Of course, {sir/madam}. You won't find better quality armour than these in all Calradia.
You have a fine eye for horses, {sir/madam}. You won't find better beasts than these anywhere else.
Anything else?
Tell me. What are people talking about these days?
Well, nothing new lately. Prices, weather, the war, the same old things.
Good-bye.
My {lord/lady}?
Good day, {sir/madam}.
I am looking for a man by the name of {s4}. I was told he may be hiding here.
Strangers come and go to our village, {sir/madam}. If he is hiding here, you will surely find him if you look around.
Pardon me, but is that a {s5} you're wearing?
Eh? What kind of gibberish is that?
Never mind.
{s4} sent me to collect your reports. Do you have them with you?
I've been expecting you. Here they are, make sure they reach {s4} intact and without delay.
Farewell.
Hę? Czego tu? Na przeszpiegi przyjechaliście, co?! .
Jestem tu z polecenia na
Proszę, proszę, lacha przysłali! Tfu.
I ja mam pod twe dowództwo dobrych mołojców oddać, co? Haha, niedoczekanie wasze.
Czołem {playername}, zwykłym zwyczajem ludzi wam potrzeba, co?^ Mam tu kilku mogących dołączyć się pod twą komendę.
koniec
Słuchaj pan... nie dam rady tego questa zrobić
A gdzie tam panie... Ja po questa.
{s0} ({reg0} złotych za jednego)
Teraz mi nie trzeba, bywajcie.
Ilu wam potrzeba?
1 ({reg0} złotych)
5 ({reg0} złotych)
10 ({reg0} złotych)
Tylu już mi starczy.
{reg0}
Nie masz wystarczająco dużo pieniędzy.
Teraz mi nie trzeba, bywajcie.
5 ({reg0} złotych)
10 ({reg0} złotych)
Żyw on?!
Przytomność biedak stracił, lecz dycha. Nie martwcie się nazbyt, nim dzień minie już do siodła będzie mu się ckniło.
Wiedziałem, że się do tego nie nadajecie. Psia wasza mać!

Musisz wiedzieć waszmość, iż druh mój w ciężkie terminy popadł. W szynku wdał się w bójkę z oficerem carskim, żeby tego było mało pułkownikiem i sprał drania do nieprzytomności... Podobno sam bez szwanku wyszedł, lecz strażnicy wzięli go za łeb do aresztu i zasądzili mu przykładną śmierć.

Głupiec to, lecz wciąż mój druh, godzi się wspomóc go w potrzebie. Egzekucja ku uciesze gawiedzi, odbędzie się za trzy dni w Debreczynie. Pojedziecie tam i przekupicie oficera dowodzącego. Cwany on i łasy na mamonę, jak hart na zajęca.
Tu jest 700 złociszy, winno starczyć. Jak sprawę załatwisz, zrazu bierz go za głowę i przywiedź tutaj. Już ja dopilnuję, aby mordy nie obił, komu nie trzeba.
{playername}, zwiadowcy donieśli mi, że okolice wsi {s20} patroluje niewielki oddział wroga. Znajdź ich i wybij do nogi, aby naszego obozu nie wypatrzyli i carskiej ekspedycji nie sprowadzili
Dostarcz Bron 2
Dezercja
Dostarcz Bron
zloto maruderow
manifesty
po tysiackroc zdrajca
Nie mam nic dla ciebie, przyjdź kiedy indziej.
What can you tell me about this village?
What can you tell me about this town?
How is life here?

Disaster has struck my family, {sir/madam}. We have no land of our own, and the others have no money to pay for our labor, or even to help us. My poor children lie at home hungry and sick. I don't know what we'll do.
My life is miserable, {sir/madam}. I haven't been able to find a job for months, and my poor children go to bed hungry each night. My neighbours are too poor themselves to help me.
Then take these 300 denars. I hope this will help you and your family.
Then clearly you must travel somewhere else, or learn another trade.
Yes {sir/madam}. I will do as you say.
{My lord/My good lady}.  You are so good and generous. I will tell everyone how you helped us.
Thank you for your kindness {sir/madam}. With your help our lives will be better. I will pray for you everyday.
Times are hard, {sir/madam}. We work hard all day and yet we go to sleep hungry most nights.
Times are hard, {sir/madam}. But we must count our blessings.
We are not doing too badly {sir/madam}. We must count our blessings.
What is your trade?
What is the latest rumor around here?
I don't know anything that would be of interest to you.
I haven't heard anything interesting lately.
[Leave]
Yes {sir/madam}?
How goes the watch, soldier?
All is quiet {sir/madam}. Nothing to report.
Good. Keep your eyes open.
Good day, {sir/madame}. Always an honor to have you here in {s10}.
Mind your manners within the walls and we'll have no trouble.
Your orders, {my lord/my lady}?
We are not supposed to talk while on guard, {sir/madam}.
Stay on duty and let me know if anyone comes to see me.
Yes, {my lord/my lady}. As you wish.
I want you to arrest this man immediately!
Who do you want arrested {sir/madam}?
Ah, never mind my high spirits lads.
Forget it. I will find another way to deal with this.
Arggh! I hate this.
Thank you for helping us against those bastards.
I will drink from your skull!
Your orders {sir/madam}?
Tell me about yourself
Aye {sir/madam}. Let me tell you all there is to know about me.
Anything else?
Nothing. Keep moving.
You have no chance against us. Surrender now or we will kill you all...
We will fight you to the end!
Don't attack! We surrender.
What do you want?
Surrender or die!
Nothing. We'll leave you in peace.
Heh! I must really be in a tight spot, to place my hopes in a passing stranger. However, something about you tells me that my trust is not misplaced. Now, go see if you can round up some volunteers.
The Heavens alone grant us victory.
I'm glad to see that you're alive, too.

Yes, yes... Now, a couple of my boys have the watch captain pinned down in a back room, with a knife at his throat. I''ll need to go drag him before {s5} and explain what this breach of the peace is all about. You don't need to be part of that, though. I'll tell you what -- if all goes well, I'll meet you in the tavern again shortly, and let you know how it all came out. If you don't see me in the tavern, but instead see my head on a spike over the city gate, I'll assume you know enough to stay out of town for a while and forget this whole episode ever happened. So -- hopefully we'll meet again!

We've always had brigands in the hills, driven to banditry by war, debt, or love of violence. Recently, however, they've been getting bolder -- leaving their camps in the wild and venturing into town, looking for unwary prey. The watch commander tells us it's because of all the fighting on the frontiers -- fewer men to keep an eye on the streets -- but I'm not sure what to make of that. It seems to me that the most logical explanation is that these bandits have an ally inside the walls, who helps them enter unnoticed and helps them identify particularly tempting targets... Last week, you see, they took my brother.

I don't know what my brother was thinking -- a lad from a prominent house, out alone after dark in times like these... Well, I suppose you were too, but you're a stranger here, and didn't know how bad things have become. He had no such excuse. But he's family, so what can you do? If you don't protect your kin, then people will start thinking that you can't protect your investements, either, and I can't have that... No doubt the gang will soon send word about a ransom, but I don't care to pay it.

So here's my proposition. You look like you've had a bit of experience with a blade -- and more importantly, you must have a bit of fire in your belly, or you wouldn't be coming to Calradia to seek your fortune. So here's what I'm asking you to do: gather a small party, track down these bandits to their lair, teach them a lesson they won't forget, and get my brother back safe. In return, you'll earn my lasting gratitude and a bit of silver. What do you say?
I am interested.
I am not interested, have more important business to do.

You won't be able to do this by yourself, though. If you try and take on the whole gang singlehandedly, the hunter will become the hunted, I'll warrant. You'll first want to round up a group of volunteers. There's always a few lads in the villages around here, looking for a bit of work that's more interesting than tilling the soil or hauling water. They'll follow you if you pay. So... Take this purse of 100 denars. Consider it an advance on your reward. Go round to the villages, and use the money to hire some help. I'll reckon that you need at least five men to take on these bandits.
Very good, sir. I'll go collect some men from around the villages.
Good. You can find me again in the tavern here in {s1} after you've got your group together. Then we'll speak about what we do next.
Pozwolisz waszmość, że się oddalę.
Surrender or die. Make your choice
I am not afraid of you. I will fight.
Hello. What can I do for you?
Tell me about yourself
Very well, listen to this...
Anything else?
[Done]
Drop your weapons and surrender if you want to live
We will fight you first
Yes, {my lord/my lady}. Which message do you wish to send to the vassals?
I want to start a new campaign. Let us assemble the army here.
I want to end the campaign and let everyone return home.
I wish to invite the vassals of the realm to a feast at {s4}.
Never mind
You wish to invite the lords of the realm to a feast?
Yes. It is time for us to strengthen the bonds that bring us together.
On second thought, this is perhaps not the time.
All right then. I shall dispatch messengers informing the lords of the realm of your feast at {s4}.
You wish to summon all lords for a new campaign?
Yes. We must gather all our forces before we march on the enemy.
On second thought, it won't be necessary to summon everyone.
All right then. I will send messengers and tell everyone to come here.
You want to end the current campaign and release all lords from duty?
Yes. We no longer need all our forces here.
On second thought, it will be better to stay together for now.
All right. I will let everyone know that they are released from duty.
Overall, the wealthiest town in Calradia is known to be {s4}. Here in {s5}, we are poorer than {reg4} towns, and richer than {reg5}.

In terms of local industry, the most productive town in Calradia is known to be {s4}. Here in {s5}, we produce less than {reg4} towns, and produce more than {reg5}. Production is of course affected by the supply of raw materials, as well as by the overall prosperity of the town.
Witam, jestem kasztelanem miasta {s2}, {s20}
Można dostać pracę w tych stronach?
Nic, żegnam.
Otóż, czas jakiś temu została {s20} pani {s21}, jak {s22}.

In terms of the output of the surrounding villages, the town of {s4} is the richest in Calradia. Here in {s5}, the villages produce less than the hinterland around {reg4} towns, and produce more than {reg5}. The wealth of a town's hinterland, of course, is heavily dependent on the tides of war. Looting and pillage, and shifts in territory, can make a major impact.

In terms of trade, the town of {s4} is believed to have received the most visits from caravans over the past few months. Here in {s5}, we are less visited than {reg4} towns, and more visited than {reg5}.
In terms of attacks on travellers, the town of {s4} is believed to be the most dangerous. Here in {s5}, we are less afflicted by bandits and raiders than {reg4} towns, and more afflicted than {reg5}.
Good-bye.

Ah, wybaczcie śmiałości, nie mogę jednak przejść obojętnie wobec cudu urody waćpanny… dzieła greckich mistrzów jawią mi się teraz jarmarczną sztuką...
Cóż za profanacja sztuki! Muszę koniecznie przedyskutować ten temat z waszmości...
Jarmarczna sztuka?! Wsadźcie lepiej głowę do studni.
Uniżenie błagam o wybaczenie, ujrzałem dziś w przelocie kostkę panny i odwieść od zamiaru zapytania się nie mogę, czy nie dostąpiłbym łaski zobaczenia innych delicji?
Oh, cóż za grubianin, jak śmiecie prosić o to… ależ z przyjemnością, w końcu nie co dzień otrzymuje się propozycję od tak sławnej persony... nie tylko kostkę wam pokażę, ale i inne specjały.
Słucham? Odejdź precz, właśnie wracam z trzy godzinnej spowiedzi. A kysz siło nieczysta!
Piękną dziś mamy aurę, nieprawdaż?
W rzeczy samej, ja wolę jednak bardziej zaciszne miejsca...
Pospolita, jak tutejszy lud. Żegnam.

Czarująco waćpanna wygląda, proszę o wybaczenie śmiałości, lecz urok przyćmił mi zmysły...
Ah, miło mi to słyszeć z ust tak szykownego kawalera...
Mi również kręci się w głowie, na tyle, że muszę udać się do cyrulika. Waszmości też to radzę, krwi nieco upuści, a następnie do zamtuzu, to też powinno pomóc. Przez życzliwość tylko radzę.
Oczarowany urodą waćpanny, chciałbym zaoferować swe usługi w każdej materii...
Niezwykle to uprzejme ze strony waszmości...
Wybaczcie, lecz ktoś już was uprzedził w ofercie...
Dziś właśnie filharmonicy Paryscy goszczą w mieście, proszę wybaczyć śmiałości, lecz czy nie wybrałaby się waćpanna na występ w mym towarzystwie?
Oh, nie znam zupełnie waćpana… z przykrością odmówię, z tego względu. Mam inną jednak propozycję...
Wybaczcie, lecz nie wchodzę w takie układy z nieznajomymi...

Podobno dobrze dziś pranie schnie, nie?
Ano, to  pójdę rozwiesić. Żegnam.
Ładną mamy dziś pogodę.
Nie to ładne co jest ładne, tylko to co komu się podoba. Ja tam wolę chłodniejszą.
Pięknie pannie  w tej sukni.
W tym fartuchu? Chyba na wzroku nie domagacie. A po drugie, to nie pannie, lecz pani, ot co.

Ah, piękną dziś mamy pogodę? Dawno tak ciepło nie było...
Oj prawda, prawda, też w takiej się lubuje, choć pragnienie większe, a może...
Tylko cuchną wszyscy wokół, ja tam lubię jak jest zimno.
Podobno kupcy ormiańscy zjadą dziś popołudniem, wiecie coś o tym?
O, tak, ale kramy rozłożą dopiero jutro. Wiedzę jednak, że waszmość też czeka, to może...
Ano może tak, może nie, kto kupca ormiańskiego wie?
Pewnikiem zanosi się na deszcz...
Trzeba zawczasu poszukać dobrego schronienia, nie uważa waszmość?
Doprawdy? W takim razie odejdę zwinąć pranie.
Zapach wiosny unosi się już w powietrzu  i słowiki śpiewają...
O tak, porządki trzeba by poczynić, choć może  nie w tej chwili jeszcze...
Ten odór? To stara zgniłą kapustę wywaliła. A wiosna to będzie, ale w kwietniu.
Proszę o wybaczenie, lecz przyznać muszę, że wygląda pani dziś uroczo...
Dziękuję waćpanu, miło mi to słyszeć od tak szanowanego człowieka...
Znalazł się, zakichany uwodziciel. Żegnam ozięble.
Panna taka markotna, a dziś muzycy przyjeżdżają z Zagrzebia...
Oh, naprawdę? Z chęcią więcej bym o nich się dowiedziała nim ich zobaczę...
Doprawdy? Pewno zbereźniki i pijusy.
Ah, zapomniałem z domu szkicownika... cóż za szkoda! Pierś pełna, lico mleczne! Godne to utrwalenia, jako wzorzec piękna dla potomnych...
Ah, prawdziwy artysta! Pozwólcie, że dotknę bo nie uwierzę... aj, może nie tu.

Cóż za cud... jakież to bóstwo nawiedziło ten padół opłakany. Ledwie myśl ludzka pojąć to może, każdy na około spuszcza oczy w pokorze... czar, to urok, siła sprawcza piękna. Ah, któż to opisać zdoła, nie podobnym to...
Ah, prawdziwy poeta! Pozwólcie, że dotknę bo nie uwierzę... aj, może nie tu.
Wybaczcie śmiałość, lecz widząc pannę pomyślałem, że brak jej rozrywki... dziś wieczorem do miasta zjeżdżają Frankfurccy kuglarze, co powiecie na towarzyszenie mi?
Wybaczcie, lecz nie znamy się dostatecznie... warto jednakby to zmienić.
